alert.note: Alert for Swains Island (American Samoa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS American Samoa (Pago Pago, American Samoa)
info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 19 at 5:23AM SST by NWS American Samoa
info.description: ...High Surf Advisory remains in effect until tonight mainly for north facing shores... * SURF...High Surfs of 10 to 12 feet with locally higher sets * TIMING...Northwest to northeast shores. * IMPACTS...through tonight. Fautuaga mo galu maualuluga Ofisa o le tau Pago Pago AS 520 TAEAO ASO TOFI IANUARI 19 2023 ...O loo faaauau le Fautuaga mo Galu maualuluga ae maise i talafatai i matu... MAFUAAGA...Galu Maualuluga e 10 i le 12 futu NOFOAGA...Talafatai i matu i sisifo seia oo i le matu i sasa`e TAIMI...Se`ia oo i le Aso Tofi AAFIAGA...E tetele galu ma e malosi aave o le sami. FAUTUAGA/TAPENAGA... O fautuaga mo galu maualuluga e faailoa mai ai le malolosi ma le tetele o galu o le a aafia ai gataifale ma matafaga, ma o le a malolosi aave o le sami e ono solo ai nisi o vaega o le matafaga. Ona o le siisii o peau o le sami, e fautuaina ai le mamalu lautele ma le au fai faiva ina ia faautagia mai lenei fautuaga ona o le maualuluga o galu ua iai nei.
info.instruction: A high surf advisory indicates large breaking waves will affect beaches in the advisory area, producing dangerous rip currents and localized beach erosion. Also, it is extremely dangerous to fish or observe waves from rocks during high surf conditions. Unwary beach walkers can be caught off guard as waves suddenly race farther up the beach than normal.
